Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Consumer complaint narrative:
Report to Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, NC XXXX XX/XX/XXXX Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX, IA XXXX Subject : Report of Violations of the Truth in Lending Act, the Securities Exchange Act of 1933, and Theft by Deception To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to report violations involving NAVY FEDERAL CREDIT UNION et al that pertain to the Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ), the Securities Exchange Act of 1933, and potential criminal activities that may include theft by deception. The details of the violations are as follows : XXXX. Violations of the Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ) : - Violation of the XXXX Right of Rescission : According to TILA regulations, consumers have the right to rescind certain credit transactions, including home equity loans and refinances, within a three-day period. It has come to my attention that [ individual/entity ] failed to provide the necessary disclosures required by TILA, including the right to rescind within the specified XXXX window, which constitutes a violation of federal law. 
- Details of Violation : - Transaction Date : XX/XX/XXXX - Parties Involved : XXXX XXXX, Navy Federal Credit Union et al - Specific Violations : Lack of clear disclosure regarding the XXXX rescission period, failure to provide the required notices, etc. 
- Evidence : See attached XXXX. Violations of the Securities Exchange Act of 1933 : - Misrepresentation and Omission of Material Facts : NAVY FEDERAL CREDIT UNION et al has engaged in conduct that violates the Securities Exchange Act of 1933 by offering or selling securities through false statements, misrepresentations, or omissions of material facts necessary for a potential investor to make an informed decision. The misleading information provided included, but was not limited to, financial projections, the actual financial condition of the business, and the risks associated with the investment. 
- Use of Registered Mail for Security Fraud : On XX/XX/XXXX, at XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX XXXX, a registered security was sent via registered mail to XXXX XXXX, using tracking number RE XXXX US. This transaction was verified through the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX ) located at XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, DC XXXX. The registered mail was delivered on XX/XX/XXXX, at XXXX XXXX  and was signed for by XXXX XXXX. Following the delivery confirmation, a period of XXXX  days was given, presumably to comply with regulatory requirements or to allow for a response or action. 
The mailing was confirmed again on XX/XX/XXXX, at XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX XXXX. This act constitutes a use of the U.S. mail system to facilitate fraudulent activities in violation of federal law, specifically under 18 U.S.C. 1341 ( Mail Fraud ). 
- Details of Violation : - Security Involved : Registered security see tracking attached - Date of Issuance or Offering : XX/XX/XXXX - Nature of Misrepresentation or Omission : no response from Navy Federal Credit Union - Evidence : [ Please see attached XXXX XXXX records, delivery confirmation, and evidence of the XXXX period granted ] XXXX. Theft by Deception : - Description of Theft by Deception : There is reason to believe that Navy Federal Credit Union et al engaged in theft by deception, which involves unlawfully taking another persons property or money by intentionally deceiving them. In this case, the deception involved providing false information or misleading statements about not receiving a registered security to gain an unlawful advantage or financial benefit. 
- Relevant U.S. Code ( USC ) Laws : - 18 U.S.C. 1341 ( Mail Fraud ) : This statute criminalizes schemes to defraud or obtain money or property through false or fraudulent pretenses using the XXXX XXXX XXXX or any private or commercial interstate carrier. The use of registered mail for sending the security falls under this provision. 
- 18 U.S.C. 1343 ( Wire Fraud ) : This law covers fraud schemes that use electronic communications, such as telephone, email, or the internet, to defraud another party. If the deceptive practices included the use of interstate wires or electronic communications to convey false or misleading information, this statute may apply. 
- 18 U.S.C. 1348 ( Securities and Commodities Fraud ) : This law specifically addresses fraud related to securities and commodities, prohibiting any scheme to defraud or obtain money or property through false or fraudulent pretenses in connection with any commodity or security. If the theft by deception was related to securities, this statute would be relevant. 
- 18 U.S.C. 1028A ( Aggravated Identity Theft ) : This statute can apply if the theft by deception involved the unlawful use of someone else 's identity, including names, Social Security numbers, or other identifying information, in furtherance of committing fraud. 
- Details of Violation : - Date of Incident : XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX - Parties Involved : XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX XXXX Nature of Deception : Security was received traded and stolen - Evidence : please see attached Demand for Action : I am demanding that XXXX XXXX provide GAAP-compliant accounting records showing all accounts payable and all accounts receivable, as well as a forensic audit on any articles or securities that may have been assigned as part of my accounts. Additionally, I request details about any loan contract or account that was assigned, including the pool of assets it was placed into, whether it was factored or included in any factoring deals. 
Furthermore, I request that XXXX XXXX provide my percentage ownership per SEC regulations regarding security trading on the primary and secondary markets. 

Request for Action : I respectfully request that the CFPB investigate the above-mentioned violations and take appropriate enforcement action to prevent further harm to consumers and investors. I am willing to provide additional information and cooperate fully with any investigation. 
Enclosures : - Mailing, Tracking and receipt of delivery Thank you for your attention to this matter. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XXXX XX/XX/XXXX, my estranged husband file for XXXX  XXXX bankruptcy. One of the debts he listed on his bankruptcy application was a master card account that my estranged husband and I were joint credit card holders. 

On or about XXXX XX/XX/XXXX, I received a telephone call from a lady from the XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ) XXXX XXXX Bankruptcy department demanding payment. She spoke in a rude and very abrasive tone of voice demanding payment. 

She went on to say that just because my husband filed for bankruptcy that I am still liable to pay the credit card bill and that I need to make an immediate payment. I made a payment that day and subsequently set up an automatic payment from my checking account for {$36.00} to pay the credit card bill every month. 

On or about XX/XX/XXXX, the XXXX Florida Bankruptcy court notified RBFCU Mastercard bankruptcy department to file any claims they may have by submitting Proof of Claims due to the Bankruptcy XXXX by XX/XX/XXXX. 

On or about XX/XX/XXXX, Randolph Brooks FCU Mastercard bankruptcy department submitted their Proof of Claim for {$1700.00} for the joint credit card account to the XXXX XXXX  Bankruptcy XXXX. Note : as of XXXX XX/XX/XXXX, {$1700.00} was the joint credit card account balance. 

On or about XX/XX/XXXX, the XXXX XXXX  bankruptcy court sent Randolph Brooks FCU Mastercard bankruptcy department check # XXXX for {$1800.00} ( {$1700.00} payment in full for the joint credit card account claim and {$2.00} interest ). 

Sometime in XX/XX/XXXX, it appeared on my credit reports that the original credit card account number was changed to a new XXXX credit card account number with the balanced transferred to the new credit card account and it stated that the account was closed by grantor with an open balance of {$1100.00}. 

Unbeknown to me that the bankruptcy court had paid the claim in full and that RBFCU had transferred the balance to a new account and was still taking payment from my checking account.

I recently found out that the Bankruptcy court had paid RBFCU the claim in full plus interest ( {$1800.00} ), On XXXX XX/XX/XXXX, I emailed RBFCU requesting to be reimburse the overpayment of $ XXXXand to correct my credit reports and to stop taking payment from my checking account. 

On XXXX XX/XX/XXXX, RBFCU responded back to my complaint, but they only reimbursed me {$250.00}. That means RBFCU collected a total of {$230000.00} for a claim they submitted for only {$1700.00} ( my payments of {$820.00} and the Bankruptcy court payment of {$1800.00} ). I strongly believe this is fraud and I should be reimbursed the total overpayment of {$820.00} and not just {$250.00}. 

In summary, as of XXXX XX/XX/XXXX, the balance due was {$1700.00} and RBFCU MC submitted a claim of {$1700.00} to the bankruptcy court in which they were paid the claim amount plus interest ( {$1800.00} plus my payments of {$820.00} ). I should be reimbursed the difference and RBFCU should not be allowed to pocket the over payment.
Company public response: None

Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/2023 I requested SECU in XXXX NC to mail check in the amount of {$180000.00} to XXXX XXXX XXXX in XXXX as IRA Trustee to Trustee Transfer. I hand-delivered the transfer request to XXXX NC XXXX XXXX XXXX. On XX/XX/2023 funds in the amount of {$180000.00} were withdrawn from my Traditional IRA account at SECU and I was advised that a check had been mailed that day by SECU. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX had not received this check as of XXXX XXXX  today on Wednesday XX/XX/2023. 

I have been inquiring of SECU for several business days where the delay was in delivery of the check.

I have just now been informed by SECU that a 3rd party vendor who is out of state has been contracted by SECU to print and mail paper checks.

SECU had not previously disclosed to me as a member that check printing and mailing was contracted to out of state 3rd party vendor. SECU staff advised me this week that they were likewise totally unaware that checks were being printed and mailed by out of state 3rd party vendor.

I have asked what city and state the 3rd party vendor is located and SECU advises me that for security reasons they can only advise that the vendor is out of state.

I find it shameful and wrong for SECU not to disclose to members and to employees that SECU has contracted with a 3rd party vendor to print and mail checks and also not to disclose the location of the out of state vendor.

If SECU had previously disclosed that checks are now being printed and mailed by 3rd party vendor who is out of state, I would have chosen to handle the transfer as rollover and taking the funds in person to XXXX XXXX XXXX. 

I have now been advised today by SECU that I must wait 10 business days to request a stop payment order on the " lost '' check that has been reported to have been mailed on XX/XX/2023 and not received by XXXX  on XX/XX/2023. 

I wish for CFPB to demand that SECU be open and transparent to members and to disclose to members that checks will be printed and mailed by out of state 3rd party vendor and that SECU disclose the location of the out of state 3rd party printing vendor
Company public response: None

On XX/XX/2023, I noticed unauthorized charges XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX on my account. After attempting to contact NFCU XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX to no avail, I successfully reported these fraudulent transactions to NFCU on the following business day, XX/XX/2023. 
Despite adhering to the timelines and providing all necessary documentation as outlined in NFCU 's Zero Liability Policy Agreement, my dispute was unjustly denied. The Zero Liability policy, as per NFCU 's formal agreement, states, " The Zero Liability policy is our commitment to get your money back, often the same day, when you're a victim of fraud. We'll investigate your fraud claim on your behalf and issue you a provisional credit. '' Similarly, XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX policy provides protection for unauthorized transactions and emphasizes the importance of reporting suspected fraud as soon as possible. 
I firmly believe that NFCU 's decision to deny my dispute is in direct violation of the Zero Liability Agreements and applicable consumer protection laws. I kindly request the CFPB 's assistance in reviewing my case and ensuring that NFCU adheres to its obligations under the Zero Liability Agreements and the relevant consumer protection regulations. 

I appreciate your attention to this matter. 

Sincerely

Consumer complaint narrative:
My mortgage was in the process of closing out my COVID forbearance and setting up a repayment plan when it was purchased by western alliance. 
I contacted them after I received my letter of servicing transfer and asked them about the status since my repayment plan hadn't been finalized in my previous servicer. They said they were still going through paperwork and had no idea the status but would get to it eventually and send me any paperwork that was required to get my repayment plan set up. 
I never received anything until I got a notice that my home was entering a foreclosure process because of all of my past due payments. 
I called and told them what happened and was told repeatedly that their computer wouldn't allow me to enter the Covid repayment deferral program to move payments to the end of the loan and the only way to become current was to submit a loan modification request and even then that wouldn't be guaranteed. 
I don't believe this servicer is familiar with the cares act or the requirements in that legislation. I should not have to have a loan modification to receive the protections that were set out in the cares act.

Sub-product: Home equity loan or line of credit (HELOC)
Sub-issue: Trying to communicate with the company to fix an issue while managing or servicing your loan
Consumer complaint narrative:
NC State Employees Credit Union took a back HELOC payment from two different accounts I have with them. This was not the first time they have done it. The first time I asked them to reverse it because I didn't have any other income coming in at the moment to care for the basic needs of my family. On XX/XX/2023 they did it again and moved the funds to cover {$360.00} this was at a time that I didn't have funds coming into account until the last day of XXXX since I started working for the school system. 

They took the funds which made other automatic outside creditors default and charge me for that. I asked the bank to show me where I signed that it was ok to move the funds. It took 3 weeks for someone to show me, because " Right of set off '' is nowhere on the promissory note. They showed me an online document on page 43 where it shares about " Right of set off '' XXXX XXXX XXXXwww.ncsecu.org/XXXX My issue is that no where was I given that understanding. Nowhere on the promissory note does it talk about my funds being pulled out of where money is in my accounts. 
1-I have my children 's accounts attached to me which will get them in a bind if I hadn't had money in other funds. 
( I will disconnect it all because I don't want them to be penalized for my doings ) 2-I now have a longer list of monies that I have to pay with other creditors because of defaulting on their automatic payments where the bank also charged for insufficient funds 3-Where does it say on the document what constitutes their authority to take the funds if I didn't get anything in writing with it? How many days before they will do it? AND when do they do it because I have been late before and it wasn't done 4-Who protects me from other creditors going after the debt I have with them? 
5-Collections said it was given to me when I opened the account it is my responsibility to know what all the bank writes that they will do. The PDF was updated in 2023, what did it say when I opened the account almost 25 years ago? Was " Right of set off '' in place then? 
6-I also did not get a letter stating what they had done until after it had been moved. Attached are the promissory note, and the letters from the bank where they took the money and sent a letter as an after thought. 

I am a Member of NCSECU but feel like a criminal, I want restitution for what happened with an apology showing me when consistently it would be taken off and where I said that they have the authority to pull those funds from any account.
Company public response: None

Consumer complaint narrative: I called PFCU around XXXX on the XXXX of XXXX, I went through the process of setting up a wire transfer to XXXX XXXX I did and answered all that was asked of me, 2 hours later i get an email from PFCU to call, but no explanation. Given the history of failures by PFCU I figured it was in regards to the wire. After several minutes I get a lady who says they needed more info to process the wire that was promised to be sent out today. She asks me verification questions that did not work and were not correct. I was told the wire of a significant amount would not go today. I was told someone in management could call me back within the next few hours. I told her I needed to speak to someone right away, finally XXXX got on the phone after another several minutes and then after explaining to him told me to wait another several minutes. As of the time of this complaint still no resolution. This is a total failure of service and seemingly an attempt to stop me from moving my money. Note- they also sent me a letter about an account I have with someone else 's last name on the letter, but with my account information. As you can see in past complaints PFCU has fallen apart and lacks competency as a financial institution. Im not sure what else regulators need to see to look into this. The President should resign as quickly as the head of secret service did. Please publish this and warn others of the toxic situation at PFCU.

Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/XXXX  I took out a boat loan with Navy Federal for the purchase of a XXXX XXXX XXXX boat with motor and trailer. The promissory note requires the information below : As promptly as possible and no later than three months, the Applicant/owner ( s ) will deliver to Navy Federal a Certificate of Title or other proof of ownership reflecting Navy Federal as the first lien holder . The Certificate of Title must also show the individual Applicant/owner ( s ) as the registered owner ( s ) of the collateral. Failure to comply with this request can result in Navy Federal converting this loans annual percentage rate to Navy Federals prevailing unsecured personal loan rate and can increase your monthly payment.

If Navy Federal exercises its right to file for the lien-recorded title, filing fees will appear as a debit on the Applicants savings account. 

The boat and trailer are registered and titled in the state of North Carolina. I verified, in XX/XX/2020 with the North Carolina XXXX  Department, who registers and titles boats, that a copy of title with Navy Federal as primary lean holder was sent in 2020. I had a duplicate copy sent to Navy Federal the same day XXXX XXXX. A receipt was emailed to Navy Federal to XXXX as I was instructed to do when I went to a branch office to fix this issue, along with the bill of sale with model and serial for the motor and trailer as well as XXXX for the boat via email on XXXX XXXX. A copy of the NC registration and tax was submitted in same email. 
My rate was corrected for the second time from 16.9 % back to the original 8.9 %. 
My rate was increased again a few months later saying they needed the same information. 

On XXXX at XXXX I called back again attempting to correct. I was informed that they never recieved any title copy from the state of North Carolina. They never recieved any emails from me. They them, after I provided date and time of email as well as each attachment, stated that no attachments were on the email. I forwarded the email back to Navy Federal. I was then told the attachments had to be in PDF format. 
I asked to speak with a supervisor who told I had to provide a copy of the title and US or foreign title or registration for the motor ( which does not exist as the motor is part of the boat ) as well as statement of origin from the manufacturer of the motor. None of this is in the promissory note as above. 
One again I was told they have not recieved anything from myself or the state of North Carolina. 
I have not missed payments. I am up to date on my loan. The information they request is not possible as it does not exist. By law, I can not obtain a copy of the title without authorization by the first lein holder which is Navy Federal, who will not authorize me to obtain. I was told no email correspondence is allowed by Navy Federal when i requested a copy of the note saying i had to provide a foreign title or registration or certificate of orgin fir the motor, so they will not provide anything to me in writing via email stating what is needed to clear this up. Each time I have sent information in the rate has been adjusted back down then raised months later. This is criminal fraud by Navy federal as I have provided and the state of North Carolina has provided the title with Navy Federal as first lein holder. 
I have a second personal loan for a golf cart that the same thing has happened with as well. The original rate was raised after purchase. The cart has no XXXX  # as it is does not exist and can not be registered. A bill of sale was provided with model and serial. The rate lowered and then raised again. 
Navy federal issued two loans, agreed to rates, after purchase raised rates and request information that is impossible to provide. Please help with these crminal financial breach of contract fraud issues. 
As I try to print my promissory note for the golf cart loan it os no longer available.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports

Consumer complaint narrative: According to 15 USC 1681 {$600.00} of the Fair Credit Reporting Act " There is a need to insure that consumer reporting agencies exercise their grave responsibilities with fairness, impartiality and a respect for the consumer 's right to privacy. '' ( Furnisher of information to credit agencies ) is a consumer reporting agency and I am the Consumer. I invoke my right to to ensure my private information IS NOT shared as backed by 15 USC 6801 which states " It is the policy of the Congress that each financial institution has an affirmative and continuing obligation to respect the privacy of its consumers and to protect the security and confidentiality of those customers nonpublic personal information. '' ( Furnisher of information to credit agencies ) is a financial institution as defined under that title 15 USC 1681 {$600.00} sec. 2 states that " In general Subject to subsection ( c ), any consumer reporting agency may furnish a consumer report under the following circumstances and no other : in accordance with the written instructions of the consumer to whom it relates. '' Additionally, these companies that furnish information to credit agencies, financial institutions and the Consumer reporting agencies XXXX, XXXX and XXXX DO NOT have my consent to furnish this information and they surely DO NOT have my written consent. Any and all consent to XXXX, XXXX XXXX, ( Furnishers of information to credit reporting agencies ), whether it be verbal, non-verbal, written, implied or otherwise is revoked. 15 USC 6802 ( b ) ( c ) states that " A financial institution may not disclose nonpublic personal information to a nonaffiliated third party unless -- the consumer is given an explanation of how the consumer can exercise that nondisclosure option. '' ( Furnishers of information to credit reporting agencies ) never informed me of my right to exercise my nondisclosure option. Not only that, 15 SUC 1681C ( a ) ( 5 ) states " Except as authorized under subsection ( b ), no consumer reporting agency may make any consumer report containing any of the following items of information. Any other adverse item of information, other than records of convictions of crimes which antedates the report by more than seven years. '' This account is an adverse item they are reporting again without my permission which is against the law. According to, 15 USC 1681 s-2 ( A ) ( 1 ) A is states " A persons shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate. Also, 15 USC 1681 e states " Every consumer reporting agency shall maintain reasonable procedures designed to avoid violations of section 1681 c of this title and to limit the furnishing of consumer reports to the purposes listed under section 1681b of this title. '' XXXX, XXXX and XXXX are not maintaining reasonable procedures. Also, 12 CFR 1016.7 states that " A consumer may exercise the right to opt out at any time. '' I AM OPTING OUT OF YOUR REPORTING SERVICES.

Issue: Problem with a lender or other company charging your account
Consumer complaint narrative:
In XXXX, on XX/XX/XXXX, and on XX/XX/XXXX, my account was charged between $ XXXX in fraudulent transactions from an unauthorized purchase at XXXX. 

Each time I contacted my bank, North Carolina State Employees Credit Union ( www.ncsecu.org, XXXX, Routing Number : XXXX ) to report the fraud, sign a fraud affidavit and place a stop payment on the merchant. 

XXXX continues to allow this fraud to take place a total of XXXX times now! On XX/XX/XXXX, I contacted them asking why my funds were still removed from my account as they allowed this fraudulent transaction to go through a third time. After being on the phone for XXXX minutes, I was told that the fraud department had no way of blocking a specific merchant as other national banks are able to do. They have to " allow '' the fraud to go through, debiting my account each time for a period of 10 days while the fraud is being investigated. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, I contacted the XXXX to find out why my funds are still not in my account after signing the fraud affidavit on XX/XX/XXXX. I was told by the call center representative that there was no record of my fraud affidavit even though there was a record of closing the debit card due to fraud. They then submitted a new report on XX/XX/XXXX, starting the 10 day hold period again! 

On XX/XX/XXXX ( XXXX minute call ), I spoke to a Call Center Supervisor, XXXX, who contacted a Fraud Manager to prioritize the XX/XX/XXXX fraud report given the history and multiple affidavits filed. When asked why the fraud affidavit was not processed when it was received on XX/XX/XXXX, she had no answer and had to investigate why the call center representative who processed the card change form dropped the ball and did NOT properly process the fraud claim. 

In addition, when a new card is issued due to fraud, the call center representative stated, " all the old stop payments and blocks are automatically removed. '' This allows new fraudulent transactions on the newly issued card!! 

This continued negligence on the part of a financial institution has caused me financial harm and they do nothing to protect customers from " known '' fraudulent transactions. After being a customer for over XXXX years, I have NO confidence that XXXX XXXX protect my financial assets going forward.

According to 15 USC 1681e ( b ) it states this ( b ) Accuracy of report Whenever a consumer reporting agency prepares a consumer report it shall follow reasonable procedures to assure maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about whom the report relates.

So I then asked them to provide me a description of the investigation according to 15 USC 1681 ( 7 ) : ( 7 ) Description of reinvestigation procedure A consumer reporting agency shall provide to a consumer a description referred to in paragraph ( 6 ) ( B ) ( iii ) by not later than 15 days after receiving a request from the consumer for that description.

But they did not do that as well either.

They are also breaking these laws as well below : According to 15 USC 1681 ( 5 ) it states this ( 5 ) Treatment of inaccurate or unverifiable information ( A ) In general If, after any reinvestigation under paragraph ( 1 ) of any information disputed by a consumer, an item of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agency shall ( i ) promptly delete that item of information from the file of the consumer, or modify that item of information, as appropriate, based on the results of the reinvestigation; and ( ) promptly notify the furnisher of that information that the information has been modified or deleted from the file of the consumer.

According to 15 USC 1681s-2 it states this. ( A ) Reporting information with actual knowledge of errors A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate. 
( B ) Reporting information after notice and confirmation of errors A person shall not furnish information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if ( i ) the person has been notified by the consumer, at the address specified by the person for such notices, that specific information is inaccurate; and ( i ) the information is, in fact, inaccurate.

Sub-issue: Didn't receive notice of right to dispute
Consumer complaint narrative:
I received a notice exhibit 1 in uploads, from Caine & Weiner dated XX/XX/year> claim they are a debt furnisher, this letter didn't advise me that I could dispute or how to dispute and it was very vague. Within ten ( 10 ) days of the date of their letter the debt collector updated this negative item to all three consumer reporting agencies. This update took place on XX/XX/year> and it was done without my written or verbal consent. Their initial letter didn't give notice that I could dispute their collection, nor did it provide the option to opt out of their communication and furnishing. 

Caine & Weiner violated my rights and the laws of the FDCPA, first by NOT obtaining written permission to furnish information pursuant to 15 USC 1681 ( b ) ( 2 ). The second violation was pursuant to 15 U.S. Code 1692g, as they did NOT send me the required written communication within five ( 5 ) days of the original letter furnishing the five ( 5 ) required information below : ( 1 ) the amount of the debt. ( 2 ) the name of the creditor to whom the debt is owed. ( 3 ) a statement that unless the consumer, within thirty days after receipt of the notice, disputes the validity of the debt, or any portion thereof, the debt will be assumed to be valid by the debt collector. ( 4 ) a statement that if the consumer notifies the debt collector in writing within the thirty-day period that the debt, or any portion thereof, is disputed, the debt collector will obtain verification of the debt or a copy of a judgment against the consumer and a copy of such verification or judgment will be mailed to the consumer by the debt collector ; and ( 5 ) a statement that, upon the consumers written request within the thirty-day period, the debt collector will provide the consumer with the name and address of the original creditor, if different from the current creditor.

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, NC XXXX To whom it may concern, I recently received a copy of my credit reports from all three credit reporting agencies and I noticed some late payments, as well as my utilization posted on my credit report. 

In the United States code, it is not stated that credit utilization nor payment history is included in your consumer report. These are factors of a FICO score, which is independent from your consumer report. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ending in XXXX Late payments ; XXXX XXXX, XXXX, XXXX, XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX XXXX - XX/XX/XXXX XXXX - current date Your company is in clear violation of the law under 15 USC - 1681B labeled under permissible purpose of consumer reports. The law clearly states : IN GENERAL Subject to section ( c ) any consumer reporting agency may furnish a consumer report under the following circumstances and no other : ( 2 ) In accordance with the written instructions of the consumer to whom it relates. 

Did I give you written instructions to furnish this account on my credit report? 

Providing I, the consumer solely with a contract does not satisfy the criteria under 15 USC 1692GB. Any and all written instruction must be clear and conspicuous according to United States code. 

Furthermore the Fair Credit Reporting Act 15 USC 1681 ( 2 ) ( a ) ( i ) - Exclusions from a consumer report clearly states : ( 2 ) Exclusions - except as provided in paragraph ( 3 ) the term Consumer Report does not include Subject to section 1681s-3 of this title any ( I ) Report containing information solely as to transactions or experiences between the consumer and the person making the report ; This pertains to the reporting of late payments/ payment history as well as my credit utilization.

Refrain from the reporting of any prior and future payment history, as well as utilization from my consumer report, this company is in violation of 15 USC 1681.

I know my rights as a consumer and this information was furnished with complete disregard to those rights.

Failure to respond satisfactorily ; with deletion of the above reference account information, as well as access to a free copy of my report after the changes have been made, via mail will result in legal action being taken against your company, for which I will also be seeking {$1000.00} per violation for : defamation of character negligent enablement of identity fraud fair debt collection practices act 15 USC 1692g violations Fair Credit Reporting acts 15 USC 1681 violations for willful non-compliance and 616 civil liability for willful non-compliance Best Regards, XXXX XXXX Enclosed : copy of ID and social security

Consumer complaint narrative: I opened an inherited IRA last year with Penfed and opted to place all funds from the IRA in a 7 year inherited IRA CD. The IRS requires that all funds are disbursed out the non spouse inherited ira within 10 years so I decided that I will begin taking disbursement on year 7 after the cd matures. I called penfed in response to a letter about ira tax withholdings I received from them. They said they are requiring me to take a distribution each year in equal payments for 10 years. I told them that I would like to wait a few years after my cd matures to take distribution. Apparently this is a penfed rule that was not explained nor written anywhere in my documents I received from them. And if thats their rules, thats fine but I should have been given some type of notice about it. I immediately requested to transfer funds to a different financial institution that will allow me to take funds out at anytime as long as the account is depleted by the 10th year per IRS guidelines. Penfed said that I would lose all interest if I transfer money out of the account before maturity but they can withdraw funds each year out of my account before maturity as a distribution. It was not explained to me that penfed could take funds out my account before maturity for distribution even though it is not required until the 10th year. They also said they will send me a letter explaining this but I should have received a letter about when opening the account. It is not my wishes to transfer to another financial institution but the deceptive practice of withdrawing money out my cd because of a penfed rule is extremely unfair and I shouldnt pay penalty fees. I will forfeit all interest earned in the CD if I transfer my money elsewhere because of their deception of not disclosing that they will withdraw money out my ira cd each year.

I am writing to formally lodge a complaint against Digital Federal Credit Union ( DCU ) for furnishing information to credit reporting agencies without my consent. Recently, I discovered that DCU has furnished my personal and financial information to the credit reporting agencies without obtaining my consent. This unauthorized sharing of information has negatively impacted my credit report and privacy.

Relevant Law : 15 U.S.C. 6802 ( b ) : " Opt-out '' Requirements : This section of the FCRA requires financial institutions to provide customers with an opportunity to opt out of the sharing of their information with non-affiliated third parties. DCU did not provide me with this opportunity, nor did I give any consent for my information to be shared.

DCU has shared my personal and financial information with credit reporting agencies without my explicit consent, violating 15 U.S.C. 6802 ( b ).

Lack of Opt-Out Opportunity : I was not given the required opportunity to opt out of having my information shared with non-affiliated third parties.

Consumer complaint narrative:
- On XXXX, I received an email from Navy Federal Credit Union ( NFCU ) dated XX/XX/ regarding an ACH from my checking account to an account at XXXX XXXX in the amount of {$5000.00}. I immediately called the NFCU XXXX team to protest this ACH as I had not authorized it, nor had I ever set up an ACH account with XXXX. Upon reviewing my account, I noted that this ACH had gone to XXXX XXXX for clothes/shoes. I do not know a person/business of that name. After discussing the situation with the NFCU fraud rep, I changed all my identifying info for my account. I was told that she would forward my protest to her supervisor, and that I would get a response within a week. 

- On the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau web site, consumers have up to 60 days to notify of a fraud. I notified NFCU in less than 1 day. 

- On the XXXX XXXX XXXX  web site, it is stated that that ACHs take at least 1 and possibly 4 days to process. I notified NFCU in less than a day. 

- On XX/XX/, I received a letter from NFCU dated XX/XX/ denying my claim based on the facts surrounding the use of my account and that I had benefitted from the transaction. It seemed to me that their letter insinuated that I was the fraudster. Additionally, the letter indicated that as a consumer, I had the right to request any documentation that was used in the decision of my claim. I called the fraud team again to protest their decision and to request the documentation they used to make that decision. The fraud rep, XXXX, said she would pass my request to her supervisor. 

- After waiting a week with no response, I called the Fraud team again on XX/XX/, I got XXXX again, and I asked her for an update. She looked through my case and said that there was no record of my protest nor my request for the documentation. She indicated that that request had to be in writing although nowhere on their XX/XX/ letter is that requirement stated. So, I wrote to request for my right to analyze their investigation. That letter went through the NFCU website to save a few days in the mail. I was told to expect a reply in 2 business days. 

- On XX/XX/ I received their response. They again denied my protest, and purposely refused to provide any information regarding their investigation. The letter appeared to me to be a boiler plate kind of response that they probably send to everyone : i.e., Please note that we are unable to provide sensitive information that does not fall within compliance. That sentence says it all, and it says nothing. And, they said it twice in the same paragraph! 

I called immediately, asked to go directly to a supervisor, and XXXX came on the line. I basically stated everything as Ive stated here, and she advised that my only recourse to gaining the investigative info was to subpoena it.

A financial institution may not disclose nonpublic personal information to a nonaffiliated third party unless ( A ) such financial institution clearly and conspicuously discloses to the consumer, in writing or in electronic form or other form permitted by the regulations prescribed under section 6804 of this title, that such information may be disclosed to such third party ; ( B ) the consumer is given the opportunity, before the time that such information is initially disclosed, to direct that such information not be disclosed to such third party ; and ( C ) the consumer is given an explanation of how the consumer can exercise that nondisclosure option.

Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Consumer complaint narrative:
I hope this message finds you well. I am writing to bring to your attention a deeply troubling issue that has recently arisen concerning my application for a credit card with the North Carolina State Employees ' Credit Union ( NCSECU ). 

As a dedicated member of NCSECU for over two decades, I have consistently demonstrated my commitment to financial responsibility and integrity. Throughout this time, I have diligently repaid every loan extended to me by NCSECU, and I have successfully paid off a previous credit card issued by the institution. Additionally, I maintain a flawless payment history on my existing credit card, which has never once been late.

Despite my long-standing loyalty and exemplary financial track record, I was shocked to receive a denial for my credit card application. What troubles me deeply is the apparent discrepancy in treatment, as individuals with comparable credit scores have been approved for credit cards by NCSECU while I have been denied.

Moreover, as someone deeply entrenched in the finance industry, specifically serving as a finance director at a reputable dealership, I have witnessed NCSECU approving loans exceeding {$10000.00} for individuals with credit histories far less favorable than mine. This inconsistency raises serious concerns regarding fairness and equity in NCSECU 's lending practices.

It is disheartening to believe that my application may have been denied based on factors beyond my control, particularly when my record of financial responsibility and loyalty to NCSECU speaks volumes.

I implore NCSECU to conduct a thorough review of my credit card application, taking into account my extensive history with the institution, impeccable repayment track record, and current credit standing. I firmly believe that these factors warrant a reconsideration of the initial decision.

I stand ready to provide any additional documentation or information that may assist in the review process. Furthermore, I am more than willing to engage in open dialogue to address any concerns or questions NCSECU may have regarding my application.

I trust that NCSECU shares my commitment to fairness and equity in its lending practices and will take prompt and decisive action to rectify this situation.

Thank you for your attention to this urgent matter. I eagerly await a favorable resolution and the opportunity to continue my positive relationship with NCSECU.
Company public response: None

Issue: Problem with a credit reporting company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Their investigation did not fix an error on your report
Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, I am writing to report a violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) by a creditor. Before the charge off of my debt, it was agreed upon that the debt would be paid in full, and that my credit report would not be impacted negatively. However, the creditor did not honor this agreement, and their violation of FCRA has negatively impacted my ability to obtain credit. 

According to the FCRA, creditors have a responsibility to report accurate information to the credit bureaus. In this case, the creditor broke our agreement, thereby violating the FCRA, which has caused damage to my credit score and limited my ability to obtain credit. 

I request an investigation into this matter, and I ask that the Creditor be held accountable for their violation of the FCRA. Additionally, I urge that you take necessary measures to ensure that the creditor corrects the inaccurate reporting on my credit report, and provides compensation for the damages they have inflicted upon me. 

I appreciate your attention and assistance in this matter, and I look forward to hearing from you regarding a resolution.

I speak to Navy Federal, and they said that the funds are stuck with the Federal Reserve because they did not receive anything, so they couldn't pay me anything.

I notified my mother again, and she went back. Her bank said they couldn't do anything. So I spoke to my bank again. 
Today, my mom went back to XXXX XXXX  XXXX and her bank said that they could not do anything and for me to submit something with my check fraud dept. 
I spoke to Navy Federal again, and they were unwilling to help me whatsoever. Saying that they couldn't do anything except for advise me on what to do, which is tell my mother to speak to her bank and send me a letter in x amount of business days saying that i didn't receive the funds.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
State employees credit union Amount : {$900.00} Opened : XX/XX/2020 I am writing to your company concerning a charge-off listed on my consumer report, which I have no knowledge of. According to 15 USC 1681 ( d ) Consumer Report. 
( 1 ) In general.The term consumer report means any written, oral, or other communication of any information by a consumer reporting agency bearing on a consumer 's credit worthiness, credit standing, credit capacity, character, general reputation, personal characteristics, or mode of living which is used or expected to be used or collected in whole or in part for the purpose of serving as a factor in establishing the consumers eligibility for ( A ) credit or insurance to be used primarily for personal, family, or household purposes ; ( B ) employment purposes ; or ( C ) any other purpose authorized under section 1681b of this title.

( 2 ) Exclusions.Except as provided in paragraph ( 3 ), the term consumer report does not include ( A ) subject to section 1681s3 of this title, any ( i ) report containing information solely as to transactions or experiences between the consumer and the person making the report A charge off can only occur when late payments are reported. However, federal law clearly and conspicuously states that reports containing information solely as to transactions or experiences between the consumer and the person making the report is an exclusion. Do late payments not fall under experiences, which are not supposed to be part of the consumer report? These late payments were reported without authorization and in clear violation of federal law.

A payment may only be treated as late if certain requirements are abided by, one including those of 15 USC 1666 B, labeled under timing of payments. It is stated ; A creditor may not treat a payment on a credit card account under an open end consumer credit plan as late for any purpose, unless the creditor has adopted reasonable procedures designed to ensure that each periodic statement including the information required by section 1637 ( b ) of this title is mailed or delivered to the consumer not later than 21 days before the payment due date.

Where is this documentation to validate these late payments that resulted in a charge off? This documentation pursuant of this statute, should have been provided to the credit reporting agencies as well as I, the consumer in order to furnish this information.

I, the consumer, am stating I received no such documentation to validate the late payments being reported.

If it is lucid that late payments are an exclusion, what is the basis of this charge-off? There is no justification for this unlawful action. I demand the immediate deletion of this account from my consumer report.

If this account is not removed within 30 days of your receipt of this letter, I will have grounds to sue. Which will include, but its not limited to ; defamation of character negligent enablement of identity fraud Fair Credit Reporting Acts 15 USC 1681 violations for willful non-compliance and 616 civil liability for willful non-compliance I am fully aware of my consumer rights, and this charge-off was reported in complete disregard of those rights. Remove this account immediately.

Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/XXXX  my account was compromised. Someone deposited fraudulent checks into my account totaling {$4200.00}. I received a letter around three days later saying that they investigated it and they found that no fraud occurred. The letter they sent me was dated XXXX, a day after I initiated my claim. I feel like if a true investigation was conducted, it would take more than a day. The representative I talked to said it would take 10-45 days. I called them back and talked with another representative and was told again that the investigation would take 10-45 days to complete. I again received a letter in the mail dated the day after my second call to them. They also sent me a copy of the checks and you can clearly see that these checks are fraudulent and the signature is not mine. These checks are for the same amount ( XXXX ). Whoever got access to my account deposited the same check multiple times. 
Once the money was available in my account, the fraudster then withdrew the money from the fraudulent checks into another account. It looks like an XXXX account. Then took my actual money ( {$1000.00} ) via member-to-member. I informed my bank that I did not know this person and I don't know how they got access to my information. 
Hopefully CFPB can help me resolve this matter so that I can get back the money that was stolen from me and put my account back in the positive.

I was made aware of the possibility of contractual fraud through diligent study and that XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX XXXX ( hereafter XXXX XXXX  ) became the debt collector for a XXXX ( Retail Installment Sales Contract ) that I endorsed from XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX and another on XX/XX/XXXX and the final endorsement on XX/XX/XXXX. Since the dealership failed their fiduciary responsibility and did not disclose the proper Truth and Lending of the XXXX I signed the contract with a blank endorsement and was not made aware that the XXXX would be sold and that my credit indeed tendered the total for the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. During the time I possessed the Grand Caravan I tendered no payments but contacted XXXX XXXX routinely from XX/XX/XXXX until XXXX XXXX  ordered a foreign collateral retrieving company to commit larceny ( XX/XX/XXXX ) under XXXX ( XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ) XXXX. Larceny of property ; receiving stolen goods or possessing stolen goods. 
( a ) Larceny of goods of the value of more than XXXX XXXX dollars ( {$XXXX} ) is a Class H felony. The receiving or possessing of stolen goods of the value of more than XXXX XXXX dollars ( {$XXXX} ) while knowing or having reasonable grounds to believe that the goods are stolen is a Class H felony. Larceny as provided in subsection ( b ) of this section is a Class H felony. Receiving or possession of stolen goods as provided in subsection ( c ) of this section is a Class H felony. XXXX XXXX  continues to refuse to submit the validation of the alleged debt pursuant 15 U.S.Code 1692g ( b ) Disputed debts If the consumer notifies the debt collector in writing within the thirty-day period described in subsection ( a ) that the debt, or any portion thereof, is disputed, or that the consumer requests the name and address of the original creditor, the debt collector shall cease collection of the debt, or any disputed portion thereof, until the debt collector obtains verification of the debt or a copy of a judgment, or the name and address of the original creditor, and a copy of such verification or judgment, or name and address of the original creditor, is mailed to the consumer by the debt collector. XXXX activities and communications that do not otherwise violate this subchapter XXXX continue during the XXXX period referred to in subsection ( a ) unless the consumer has notified the debt collector in writing that the debt, or any portion of the debt, is disputed or that the consumer requests the name and address of the original creditor. Any collection activities and communication during the XXXX period XXXX not overshadow or be inconsistent with the disclosure of the consumers right to dispute the debt or request the name and address of the original creditor. 
XXXX XXXX repeatedly reports a Charged-Off/Written-Off debt to the Consumer Reporting Agencies in the attempt XXXX damage my credit standing and my full faith and credit credentials. XXXX XXXX has reported the same alleged debt XXXX times in XX/XX/XXXX. XXXX XXXX violated XXXX Chapter 75 Article 2 7553. Unreasonable publication. 
No debt collector shall unreasonably publicize information regarding a consumer 's debt. Such unreasonable publication includes, but is not limited to, the following : ( 1 ) Any communication with any person other than the debtor or his attorney, except : a. To designated third parties with the written permission of the debtor or his attorney. 
b. To persons employed by the debt collector, to a credit reporting agency, to a person or business employed to collect the debt on behalf of the creditor, or to a person who makes a legitimate request for the information. 
c. To the spouse ( or XXXX who stands in place of the spouse ) of the debtor, or to the parent or guardian of the debtor if the debtor is a minor and lives in the same household with such parent. If the debt collector has a good faith belief that the exception set forth in this subsubdivision applies to a particular communication, that communication shall not be a violation of this subsubdivision. 
d. For the sole purpose of obtaining location information about the debtor, if no indication of indebtedness is made. A debt collector making a communication under this subsubdivision shall : 1. Identify himself or herself, state that he or she is attempting to confirm or correct location information about the debtor, and, only if expressly requested to do so, identify his or her employer.

2. Not state that the debtor owes a debt.

3. Not communicate with any particular person more than once per week or a total of XXXX times during any XXXX period unless requested to do so by the person. 
e. Through legal process. 
( 2 ) Using any form of communication which ordinarily would be seen or heard by any person other than the consumer that displays or conveys any information about the alleged debt other than the name, address and phone number of the debt collector except as otherwise provided in this Article.

NC General Statutes - Chapter 75 Article 2 3 ( 3 ) Disclosing any information relating to a consumer 's debt by publishing or posting any list of consumers, except for credit reporting purposes and the publication and distribution of otherwise permissible " stop lists '' to the pointofsale locations where credit is extended, or by advertising for sale any claim to enforce payment thereof or in any other manner other than through legal process. ( 1977, c. 747, s. 4 ; 1979, c. 910 ; 2015177, s. 2. ) It is therefore safe to conclude without a shadow of doubt the GM FINANCIAL, et al has conspired since XX/XX/XXXX to destroy my Consumer image and to destroy my XXXX score. We are currently in the beginning stages of Arbitration now.

Consumer complaint narrative:

Earlier this year I began having severe headaches and many health issues and it led to missing a lot of time from work which caused me to have struggles with my mortgage payment to State Employee Credit Union. However while in recovery I received a letter from a law firm telling me that my home was in foreclosure. 
State Employee Credit Union has engaged in unethical servicing practices and has denied access to programs to help homeowners and instead pushed me into foreclosure. They are putting profits over people. I bought my home in XX/XX/XXXX with an {$85000.00} down payment and used SECU because of my long relationship with them. I am extremely disappointed in the way they have handled this situation. 

When I first became ill in XX/XX/XXXX I missed three months of payments. I made the double payment for XXXX .I found out in XXXX that I had a XXXX XXXX and required multiple tests and a hastily scheduled XXXX. As a result I was unable to make the XXXX double payment. I spoke to XXXX at SECU in XXXX and explained my situation. She did not disclose or discuss any options for assistance programs instead telling me to apply for the state program. 

Later that month I received a letter from a law firm while I was recovering from XXXX. They told me they were going to foreclose on my home. I called SECU and explained what had happened and told them that I talked to someone in their office and they gave me a plan and this should not be happening. The SECU agent told me that this man no longer worked in that department and that he did not make any notes regarding this plan so they had no evidence of the plan because it was a verbal agreement. The agent continued and said as far as the collections department was concerned, there was nothing in place so they initiated foreclosure. 

On their website SECU says Members can meet face to face with a Senior Financial Services Officer of the Credit Union to develop an individualized financial plan. We are committed to meet with members having problems wherever and whenever to discuss, review and develop a short term repayment plan that works. We want to help members keep their homes.They go on to list Options that may be considered are temporary modification of the payment amount or temporary deferment of monthly payment or modifying the terms of the existing loan None of this happened. None of these options were presented to me. One employee offers help by suggesting I make double payments. A different employee says that help does not exist because they now work in a different department etc. I have worked as a registered nurse for 26 years and have always paid my bills on time. My health situation was unexpected and scary because they were not sure what the problem was. I missed a lot of time from work and used up all of my PTO and that is why I missed my payments. I thought I was getting better and resumed my payments and made an agreement to make double payments and then I got sick again and found out about the XXXX. I was unable to work for two months and had to wait to get approved for short term XXXX which contributed to the financial issues. While I was recovering from my XXXX they started the foreclosure process against me.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I used to have a checking account with Navy Federal in XXXX. This person put my checking account number on a check for {$9800.00} to Navy Federal Headquarters in Virginia on XXXX XX/XX/XXXX and then removed {$8900.00} on XXXX XX/XX/XXXX. I NEVER noticed the money in my account since, at the time, I did NOT check my account every day. Nothing was ever said to me regarding this check by Navy Federal until this year on XXXX XX/XX/XXXX when I presented to Navy Federal that my new Debit Card was NOT working. NOTE : The account in question was cancelled by myself, along with my husband 's checking account due to them changing their cash checking policies for my husband. I opened a NEW checking account on XXXX XX/XX/XXXX, and so did my husband. We were told to check out new Debit Cards by running a Balance Inquiry to see if they worked and they both did. Then on XXXX XX/XX/XXXX, I went to use my new debit card for gas, and it was declined. I went right back to Navy Federal and explained the situation. They had me test it on their ATM, to withdraw {$20.00}, and it told me " Your card is not set up for this type of transaction. '' I then went back to the XXXX  and asked why it said that. She then asked another XXXX to approach and explain what she was seeing on the screen. I was asked if I knew anything about a {$9800.00} fraudulent check put into my account in XXXX. I was shocked at this! We then went back to her office, and she began making phone calls regarding this issue, as they had also just taken the {$220.00}, I had deposited earlier that day, in cash, back out and applied it to this fraudulent check. 
When I returned home, I explained what was going on to my husband. He then began doing some investigating on this issue since it was NOT ME that deposited this check! He found out that the woman on the check XXXX XXXX XXXX went by quite a few different names and lived at a lot of different addresses. The address on the check " XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, AL XXXX. ***ALSO, one of the addresses she lived at was XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX AL XXXX which my husband found out was an XXXX XXXX. It also turns out that this " XXXX  '' was sold on the same date as the check was written, XXXX XX/XX/XXXX. 
We are trying to get to the bottom of this because we have NOTHING to hide. I gave all this information to Navy Federal on XXXX XX/XX/XXXX and it was submitted electronically to the Headquarters in Virginia. They have accepted my proof but will not talk to me so that I may explain what they are looking at. I was told this when I called on XXXX XX/XX/XXXX when the XXXX 's told me to contact Security after a couple hours of turning in my letter of proof. 
It has now been 3 weeks total, and they are confiscating any monies deposited into my checking account, to the fact of {$3700.00} which was my Federal Income Tax Refund. This is so unfair and after doing more research, Navy Federal is to release my funds " temporarily '' back to me until their investigation is complete. I found that on the Consumer Protection Agencies website on XXXX XX/XX/XXXX. 
Please have them release my funds back to me as now my NC State Refund check will be going in soon and they will keep that as well. UNFAIR TO ME AS A CONSUMER! They've already decided I'm guilty without even letting me explain the proof that I had given to them. 
I am hereby filing a FORMAL COMPLAINT against Navy Federal Credit Union regarding this issue and have also submitted a complaint to the Federal Trade Commission. Report Number XXXX. 
I'm having issues with my printer so I can not scan anything to send other than what is already on my laptop 's hard drive.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Consumer complaint narrative:
We were advised by an XXXX XXXX XXXX to make this complaint to the CFPB. 

It is our hope that this complaint toward our banking institution, the NC State Employees Credit Union, gets an them to acknowledge our loss as fraudulent and recognize the their lack of guidance in part as we made a wire transfer in the amount of {$100000.00} last XX/XX/XXXX. 

On our first call to them once we realized we had been victimized we were told the XXXX " protects their members '' and would work to get our money back. Once we went to the credit union in person to report the crime we followed the credit union officer 's directions to file a police report and wait for a response from the real XXXX XXXX department on a decision to cover the loss. We also filed reports to the Federal Trade Commission and the FBI. 

We waited for weeks and finally were told that by XXXX that our transaction could not be returned to our account because we signed the wire transfer paper. I appealed to the same teller a month or so later and he told me the same but that he would look to see if the money could be recovered under the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX but it was unlikely. I never heard back from him. 

Our main complaint is that the teller should have immediately consulted with a branch manager to meet with us before we made such large wire transfer. That way we would have been able to rethink our decision and the thieves would not have gotten our retirement savings. When it didn't go through the first time and the person posing as a XXXX XXXX  XXXX called us and instructed us to return to the credit union to change the " beneficiary '' on the wire transfer paper. When we walked in the teller recognized us and said, " I was just about to call you to come back because the transfer didn't go through. '' At that point we feel like we did not receive the guidance we should have to reconsider the transaction. Instead, we gave him the new beneficiary information provided to us by the thief and it went through. This is when we felt he should have called in a branch manager. 

Below is the statement I provided to the FBI as a narrative of the chain of events that led to the loss of our XXXX XXXX XXXX funds. Now we face a huge tax bill. 

XX/XX/XXXX, XXXX XXXX, XXXX XX/XX/XXXX : I received an email from XXXX XXXX that looked official stating that an order was ready that I did not make. It was a purchase for XXXX and another for guns. I called the number on the email that stated " if you did not make this purchase '' please call. I was connected to an " agent '' for XXXX XXXX who tried to help me but we were disconnected. A different " agent '' called ( XXXX ) and told me to open an app called XXXX XXXX on my phone. This call also failed so finally a man who identified himself as " XXXX XXXX '' the " XXXX XXXX for XXXX XXXX '' called and asked me to open the application on my desk top. My husband and I did this together. At that time he ran us through several searches to prove to us that we had been hacked and that he would take care of this problem for us. He also gave me figures of other " pre-authorized '' charges pending on my account. {$1400.00}, {$1800.00}, {$2200.00}, and I had one for {$380.00} on the XXXX XXXX " invoice ''. 

He had me give him the phone number for the call center for my bank. He said he was going to send them a message and that a someone would get back to me. Within minutes a person identifying himself as " XXXX XXXX '' called and explained he was from State Employees Credit Union ( my bank ) XXXX department. I questioned the phone number XXXX ( XXXX ) XXXX as it was from XXXX and he explained to me that all banks have their XXXX  headquarters in XXXX . He then gave me the exact figures of preauthorized amounts that were pending on my State Employees Credit Union. I emailed the XXXX to put a block on my account and he said that was fine. 

XXXX XXXX also knew the name of my XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX and told us that someone had made a request to withdraw {$100000.00} and that I would have to make my own request quickly so that the " hackers '' would not get it. He gave us rules because he said that no one could be trusted and that the hackers could be someone from XXXX XXXX or XXXX. He even asked me if I trusted my XXXX XXXX! The same week I had sent a message to our XXXX XXXX advisor requesting an appointment so this seemed like a possible place the hackers could have gotten in. 
The Rules : Only speak to XXXX XXXX, Don't tell anyone, Can talk to family but only to say the problem was resolved, Can withdraw funds from XXXX but to let him know first. 

After that call " XXXX '' called me back and told us to keep my phone lines open so they could try to " catch '' the hackers. This continued for days and hours on my phone and my husband 's phone. Always with sincere concern for my XXXX and promises to have this situation corrected. I continued to follow directions from him and the other person but always questioning their titles and what they were doing. I have over XXXX text messages from them. 

The actual thefts occurred between XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX because the XXXX weekend delayed transfer of funds. 

Following XXXX 's directive, I called XXXX XXXX from XXXX XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX to request our withdrawal of all funds from our retirement funds, XXXX told me to make up a scenario if I was asked why I wanted to withdraw ALL the funds. He said XXXX XXXX or someone at his office could not be trusted. My agent, while taken aback, explained it could not happen until after XXXX. 
So, the following Monday XX/XX/XXXX My husband and I both requested our funds by my cellphone from XXXX XXXX. The funds would be available by Thursday XX/XX/XXXX. In the meantime, my husband 's was on an open line with XXXX. So he heard the requests. The total amount requested was {$110000.00}. XXXX XXXX withheld money for a XXXX for taxes. 

XX/XX/XXXX : XXXX XXXX had me open an account with XXXX XXXX ( a digital bank ) while he was on Any Desk on my computer. That afternoon XXXX again gave us specific instructions for wiring the {$10000.00} out of my checking account to XXXX XXXX that he had me open that morning. He made sure that I used the exact name on the account I opened on the wire transfer form and that he wanted to stay on an open line while I was in the bank so he could hear what we were saying. Our teller 's name at XXXX. I was instructed to wire the money to XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX # XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, XXXX  XXXX. Beneficiary was to be XXXX XXXX, XXXX Account # XXXX Routing # XXXX Address : XXXX XXXX XXXX, suite XXXX, XXXX XXXX, XXXX was the beneficiary. I did this under great duress with my husband at my side. He instructed me to " act normal '' because the teller may not be trusted. 
Once back in the car he asked for me to send a picture of the wire document and quickly told us to go back bank because the teller had put my name as it is stated on my XXXX accounts and made me the beneficiary. Returning to the bank the teller saw us and said he was about to call me because the wire did not go through with the way my name was stated. This time, because I was unable to do any further transactions due to stress, explained to the teller the corrections changing the name and beneficiary to what is mentioned above. The teller did not call a branch manager but proceeded to conduct the wire transfer. 

XX/XX/XXXX : The calls from XXXX continued on my husband 's phone while XXXX called me and again had me open Any Desk on my desktop computer, open my XXXX XXXX Account and with control of my computer began moving small amounts of that {$100000.00} into XXXX Reference # XXXX. He explained he had to do smaller amounts at a time so that the hackers could not trace it. 
He sold {$96000.00} Reference # XXXX and began the withdrawals using the XXXX XXXX app on my computer. He said, " You can go do your work Mam, and I will do mine. '' I have email documentation of all withdrawals on XX/XX/XXXX as follow ; {$11000.00} ref : XXXX, {$11000.00} ref : XXXX, {$19000.00} ref : XXXX, {$19000.00} ref : XXXX, {$22000.00} ref : XXXX, {$9800.00} ref : XXXX, {$9800.00} ref : XXXX. {$4900.00} ref : XXXX For XXXX or XXXX of these I received emails stating the transactions were cancelled but XXXX XXXX would continue to try. XXXX told me to ignore these. 

XX/XX/XXXX : Final withdrawal {$13000.00} ref : XXXX XX/XX/XXXX : XXXX apparently became ill and was " in hospital '' so XXXX called me to open another account this time with XXXX while he continued to monitor our phones and send text messages. XXXX called me later to verify the account. He had me stay on the line while I called XXXX local to verify but it would not go through. The XXXX XXXX account was now at {$0.00} and they were trying to get the last of the retirement money through XXXX. 

XX/XX/XXXX : XXXX texted me asking if I had gotten that verification email yet from XXXX. I had not. I had moved {$12000.00} out of my checking account to my XXXX Account with XXXX because I was concerned that it was all I had left. XXXX had me move it back to my checking account so I moved {$13000.00} and was waiting for verification to begin the securing these funds when the XXXX account was verified. 

XX/XX/XXXX : XXXX is continuing to be sick and XXXX is trying to follow up with me to get the last of the money stolen. All the while reassuring and even promising me that the money will be back in my account soon. I spoke to him by phone and said I was going to call the FBI and he said, " Ma'am are your trying to scare me? Because we won't be scared. We are working for you to secure your funds and your IP Address. '' In text, " ... just wait patiently, everything will be find and tomorrow you will have all your questions answered. '' My text : " The XXXX XXXX account is XXXX balance, the crypto.com does not work. I have been looking into my XXXX XXXX help section to figure out if I did the wrong thing by calling the number on the email. '' XXXX 's reply : " Your thinking to much ma'am! '' My text : " Does XXXX XXXX  even send emails for orders? '' XXXX 's reply : " I already told that there are certain steps has been taken by your bank ( XXXX XXXX ) to secure your funds! '' Don't think too much it might effect your health... forget everything, have a good sleep and tomorrow you once you get your answers then you would be happiest one. '' And, " Whenever customer has any fraudulent charges every financial company ( aka XXXX XXXX ) sends emails. We never call our customers first. '' My text : " How did XXXX XXXX know these charges were fraudulent? '' " I want to call my XXXX XXXX '' XXXX 's reply : " Because XXXX know you and your the owner of not your ( financial ) advisor. '' And, " mark my words by tomorrow morning you will get your answers and everything will be fine. '' He tells me that XXXX will call me on a new secure line by XXXX est the next day. XXXX ( XXXX ) XXXX because of inactivity on the old number a new one was created. 

XX/XX/XXXX XXXX calls from this number but within a few minutes the call disconnects and I am not able to all it back. Same with XXXX 's number. All contact has been cut by them. 

I then went to the bank to report the incident and we closed our checking account, followed direction to file a XXXX, XXXX police incidence report reference number XXXX. In the following days that week I also made a report to the FTC per my XXXX XXXX XXXX account. I also called XXXX XXXX to lock my account and made disputed reports for all transactions. A report to the FBI was also made and the above narrative was sent to that report. 

Again, this complaint is to have the XXXX acknowledge their role in our loss and hopefully be able to return the money to our account via XXXX.

Consumer complaint narrative: I made my payment to Avant on XX/XX/XXXX. The funds were available in my account at the time of payment. On XX/XX/XXXX the payment was declined. I was charged a late fee as well. I spoke to multiple reps and was hung up on while attempting to resolve this matter. The funds were still in the account for the payment being made so I asked if we can process the payment via debit since they were having problems processing it via ACH. I transferred the funds to my account that has a debit card linked to it and provided the rep with the card number. They stated they were having issues on their end with the payment. I asked if they would like to try another card. They stated they would try my card on file and read me the number. The number they read was not a card but an account number for my ACH payments. I stated no do not use that account because it will take days to process. The rep proceeded to process it anyway. I explained I wanted to make a debit payment so its processed today. They said they canceled the ACH and took another debit card that I moved the money to and this payment went through. They apologized for the inconvenience and stated they would submit a request for the fee waiver because of a processing error. This morning when I woke up I had an email stating the waiver was declined and I also saw they took two payments instead of one. One of these payments is unauthorized. They stated it would take 14 days to resolve. So they are charging me fees based on their error and taking unauthorized payments. I spoke to a supervisor who refused to help and hung up on me. I have now called over 5 times trying to resolve my issue. This is a violation of TILA.
